commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Excuse me. I've brought the schedule for future election activities-- ...No one's here. I'll just leave it-- ...What's this?

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: (It's Nana's pledge. I can't believe it's been placed here in plain view.)

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: (Hm?)

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Introduce a social networking app for the school dedicated to creating a space where students can realize their passions.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Post via app for rapid spread of information within the student council. Different categories for posts include studies, clubs, social, facilities, etc. to boost circulation.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: Support students through prioritizing their independence by having them think and choose for themselves.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: I see. So what she said at the public debate wasn't just a passing thought. I thought this would be an easy battle, but it looks like I need to reevaluate my opponent.

commands.speaker: Shioriko
commands.line: But her foundations are still mistaken. She's a student herself, so there's no point if the benefits of this pledge don't apply to her.

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: What?! Setsuna quit the club?!

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Why did it have to come to that? Was the result of the public debate really that bad?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: While the public debate did end with Mifune having the upper hand, I feel like that's not the only reason.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Eli-chi, you mentioned that you'd gotten a few messages and calls from Setsuna, right?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Yes, Dia and I did. She said she wanted our opinions as student council presidents.

commands.speaker: Nozomi
commands.line: Then let us ask you two. Did something seem off about her when you spoke to her?

commands.speaker: Dia
commands.line: Well, we sent messages to her out of concern following the public debate, but nothing seemed particularly out of the ordinary at the time. Right?

commands.speaker: Eli
commands.line: Yes, that's right. She did mention that her opponent has the upper hand, but her resolve to rally seemed stronger than her disappointment.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: We tried to ask her more about it, but...

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Argh, geez! Nothing will get solved by just yapping about it! It's time to ring her phone off the hook! Call her like mad!

commands.speaker: Nico
commands.line: Grrr... C'moooon! Why won't she answer?!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: Okay! I'll give it a try this time!

commands.speaker: Mari
commands.line: She's not answering... Why, oh, why, Setsu?!

commands.speaker: Maki
commands.line: She won't answer my calls, either.

commands.speaker: Kotori
commands.line: No good for me as well.

commands.speaker: You
commands.line: Me too.

commands.speaker: Hanamaru
commands.line: I wonder why. There aren't many things she can do alone, zura.

commands.speaker: Ruby
commands.line: Yeah. Being alone is so disheartening.

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Hey now, you two! Don't you get all teary-eyed! If we can't get to her by phone, then...

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: That's right!! I'll use my fallen angel telepathic powers and...!

commands.speaker: Hanayo
commands.line: How about writing a letter?

commands.speaker: Yoshiko
commands.line: Listen to me!

commands.speaker: Kanan
commands.line: Yes, yes, we'll try out your telepathy next time. A letter sounds like a great idea! All right, let's all do this together!

commands.speaker: Karin
commands.line: I wonder if she'll read our letter.

commands.speaker: Ayumu
commands.line: Our feelings might get across better through written words rather than a text message.

commands.speaker: Rin
commands.line: That's right! Then we can bring Setsuna back!

commands.speaker: Ai
commands.line: We can't even go talk to her if we wanted to because she's cooped up in the student council room all the time lately.

commands.speaker: Shizuku
commands.line: When we see her in the hallway, she avoids eye contact and quickly walks away. We're afraid of hurting her by talking to her, so we've been holding ourselves back.

commands.speaker: Umi
commands.line: Is that so? That must've been tough. But don't give up! We need to tell Setsuna how important she is to us!

commands.speaker: Rina
commands.line: We have to tell her she's special to us.

commands.speaker: Emma
commands.line: Rina, let's write a letter, together.

commands.speaker: Kasumi
commands.line: Considering the circumstances, I'm going to write a reeeeeeeeeally long letter!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Honoka, Chika, I'm sorry, but do you two mind taking care of the rest?

commands.speaker: Honoka
commands.line: Not at all! You're going to go see Setsuna, right? I figured you'd say that. It'll be fine! Leave it to us!

commands.speaker: Chika
commands.line: We'll continue preparations for the School Idol Festival, so don't worry about it! That, and the letter to Setsuna, too!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Thank you! I'll go see her!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: I've finally managed to meet with you, Setsuna.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Huh? What are you doing here?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: You've been avoiding us lately, and you won't let us see you in the student council room. I camped here waiting for you since all students come through here.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Let's have a proper talk. I just met up with everyone from μ's and Aqours. Everyone is worried sick about you.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: I know. I've received all of their phone calls.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: None of us want you to quit being a school idol, Setsuna.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: But we also understand that you need to give it your all for the student council presidential election. If that's the case, then you can put your effort into both...

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: That's the problem! Everybody helps me so generously. That's exactly why I figured I had to quit the club.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: What do you mean?

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Now is the time for everyone to work together as one in preparation for the School Idol Festival. I can't make them do anything unnecessary.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: It's not unnecessary!

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: But you and the others forgot to send messages about our gatherings and about the songs for the mini live show, right? Because you were helping me.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Well... They were just little slips of the mind. We'll be more careful from now on!

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: They might have been little slip-ups this time, but you don't know what might happen next time. It'll be too late to act once something has happened.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Setsuna...

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: But that doesn't mean you should have to sacrifice yourself in all of this. If we all work hard together, then we can win the election and...

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Some things cannot be achieved by working in half measures.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Winning against Mifune is no easy task. Similarly, reviving the School Idol Festival is no easy task either.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Which is why I want you to focus solely on bringing the School Idol Festival back, not half-heartedly, but wholeheartedly.

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: There's no point in having the School Idol Festival without you, Setsuna! Without you, it'd just be...

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: So you're just going to give up? Is that the extent of your love for school idols?

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: No way I'd give up!

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: Then please, respect my choice of method. I will retain the student council presidency no matter what, and I will protect the club.

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: This is the path I have chosen to bring back the School Idol Festival!

commands.speaker: [player]
commands.line: Well, what about YOUR love of school idols? What will happen to that?!

commands.speaker: Nana
commands.line: *Gasp* ...That's the end of this conversation. It's late now, so you should also hurry on home and rest.
